results.adx_keywords: Hair;Baldness;Rogaine (Drug);Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Doctors;Medicine and Health;Generic Brands and Products
results.title: An Old Medicine Grows New Hair for Pennies a Day, Doctors Say
results.abstract: Dermatologists who specialize in hair loss say that the key ingredient in a topical treatment worked even better when taken orally at a low dose.

media.caption: Brandy Gray, 44, was seen by Dr. Crystal Aguh before and after treatment with oral minoxidil.
media.copyright: Crystal Aguh/Johns Hopkins School of Medicine

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Content Type: Personal Profile;Molina, Yadier;St Louis Cardinals
results.title: After 19 Years of ‘Managing,’ He Finally Gets to Be a Manager
results.abstract: When Yadier Molina’s playing career ends this fall, he’ll head to Venezuela to coach. His qualifications? “I’ve managed for 19 years in the big leagues.”

media.copyright: Aaron Doster/Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations;Attorneys General;War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity;Missing Persons;Lopez Obrador, Andres Manuel;Pena Nieto, Enrique;Mexico;Iguala (Mexico)
results.title: Mexico Arrests Top Prosecutor in Case of Missing Students and Issues 80 Warrants
results.abstract: The country’s former attorney general, accused of covering up the probable massacre of 43 students, was charged with forced disappearance, torture and obstruction of justice.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media.caption: A mass grave in Guerrero, Mexico, where 28 bodies were found in 2014. The remains of only three of the missing 43 students have ever been identified.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Gender;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Books and Literature;Vincent, Norah
results.title: Norah Vincent, Who Chronicled Passing as a Man, Is Dead at 53
results.abstract: Her best-selling 2006 book about that experience, “Self-Made Man,” made her a media darling. But it cost her psychologically.

media.caption: Norah Vincent in 2001 in her neighborhood on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. For a book, she spent 18 months living as a man named Ned, putting him in hypermasculine situations.
media.copyright: Chester Higgins Jr./The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Airports;Luggage and Packing;Robberies and Thefts;Lost and Found Property;De Luca, Giovanni;Apple Inc;Delta Air Lines Inc;Destin (Fla)
results.title: She Had an AirTag in Her Lost Luggage. It Led Police to a Baggage Handler’s Home.
results.abstract: An airport worker in Florida was charged with two counts of grand theft after a tracking device aided a sheriff’s investigation.

media.caption: The authorities in Florida traced an Apple AirTag that had been placed in a traveler’s luggage to a baggage handler’s home.
media.copyright: Carlos Jaramillo for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Law and Legislation;States (US);Doctors;Center for Reproductive Rights;Baton Rouge (La);Louisiana
results.byline: By Ava Sasani and Emily Cochrane
results.title: ‘I’m Carrying This Baby Just to Bury It’: The Struggle to Decode Abortion Laws
results.abstract: At a Louisiana hospital, concerns about complying with new abortion bans in post-Roe America left a pregnant woman with a devastating diagnosis, but not an abortion.

media.caption: After a recent court ruling that allowed Louisiana’s abortion bans to go into effect, the abortion provider Hope Medical Group for Women in Shreveport said that it would move out of the state.
media.copyright: Emily Kask for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Appraisals and Valuation (Property);Black People;Race and Ethnicity;Mortgages;Discrimination;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Baltimore (Md);Maryland
results.title: Home Appraised With a Black Owner: $472,000. With a White Owner: $750,000.
results.abstract: Nathan Connolly and his wife, Shani Mott, say an appraisal company undervalued their home based on their race. The couple has filed a lawsuit in Maryland.

media.caption: Nathan Connolly and Shani Mott are suing an appraiser and a mortgage lender after their Baltimore home was estimated to be worth $472,000. After the couple removed any indications that Black people lived there, a second appraiser valued the home at $750,000.
media.copyright: Shan Wallace for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Workplace Hazards and Violations;Corporate Social Responsibility;Nonfungible Tokens (NFTs);Politics and Government;DeSantis, Ron;Bed Bath & Beyond Inc;Big Ten Conference
results.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Vivian Giang, Stephen Gandel, Lauren Hirsch, Ephrat Livni and Jenny Gross
results.title: Florida’s ‘Stop WOKE’ Act Gets Pushback in Court
results.abstract: A federal judge blocked a key provision of the state’s law aimed at private businesses, calling it something you might find in an alternate universe.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida signed the Individual Freedoms Act this year.
media.copyright: Chris O'Meara/Associated Press

results.title: Bruce Reinhart, the Magistrate Judge Who Approved the Mar-a-Lago Search

results.title: HBO Max Pulls Nearly 200 ‘Sesame Street’ Episodes
results.abstract: HBO Max took down classic episodes of “Sesame Street” as it prepares to combine with Discovery+. The move came as a surprise to fans, who worried about what it signals.

media.caption: Most of the “Sesame Street” episodes removed from HBO Max aired before 2008.
media.copyright: Landon Nordeman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;Busey, Gary;Malibu (Calif)
results.title: Gary Busey Faces Sex Charges After Appearance at Film Convention
results.abstract: The actor, 78, was a featured guest at Monster-Mania Con in Cherry Hill, N.J. He was charged with two counts of criminal sexual contact, among other counts, the police said.

media.caption: The actor Gary Busey, who earned an Oscar nomination for his role in the 1978 film “The Buddy Holly Story,” was charged on Saturday, the police said.
media.copyright: Chris Maggio for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Lettuce;Food Contamination and Poisoning;E Coli (Bacteria);Fast Food Industry;Wendy's International Inc;Indiana;Michigan;Pennsylvania;Ohio
results.title: Lettuce on Wendy’s Sandwiches Potentially Linked to E. Coli Outbreak
results.abstract: Federal health officials said that while 37 people had been sickened and 10 hospitalized, it was safe to eat at the fast-food chain and to buy romaine lettuce.

media.caption: Romaine lettuce used on Wendy’s sandwiches is being investigated as a possible cause of dozens of E. coli cases in at least three states.
media.copyright: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

results.title: Vanessa Bryant Testifies in Trial Over Kobe Bryant Crash Photos

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Katie Benner and Glenn Thrush
results.title: The Final Days of the Trump White House: Chaos and Scattered Papers
results.abstract: Government documents that President Donald J. Trump had accumulated were with him in roughly two dozen boxes in the White House residence. They were to go to the National Archives, but at least some ended up in Florida.

media.caption: President Donald J. Trump and his wife, Melania, leaving the White House for the last time on Jan. 20, 2021.

results.title: How Pharmacy Work Stopped Being So Great
results.abstract: Two years of economic recovery brought strong gains to workers at the top and the bottom, but headwinds for those in between. Consider the pharmacist.

results.title: Survivor of White House Lightning Strike Embraces Third Chance at Life
results.abstract: On her 28th birthday, Amber Escudero-Kontostathis was struck by lightning in Lafayette Square. Three other people died. Her heart stopped twice, but she lived.

media.caption: Amber Escudero-Kontostathis, 28, was the sole survivor of a deadly lightning strike near the White House.

results.title: Graham Ordered to Appear Before Atlanta Grand Jury Investigating Trump
results.abstract: A federal judge declined to stay her order that Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina appear on Tuesday before a special grand jury in Atlanta.

media.caption: Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina has fought a subpoena to appear in person before a special grand jury in Atlanta that is investigating efforts by Donald J. Trump and his allies to overturn the results of the 2020 election in Georgia.
media.copyright: Sarahbeth Maney/The New York Times
